step1.sentence: New employees are expected to follow the rules during their probationary period.

step2.story: The designer had always followed the rules of good typography — until a project required her to break several of them deliberately. The result was striking precisely because she understood the rules well enough to know which ones, broken in exactly this way, would produce the right effect.

step3.story: The children had been given a board game with twenty-three rules. Within ten minutes, they had modified seven of them. By the end of the afternoon, the game they were playing was unrecognizable from the original. The teachers watching did not intervene. They were observing something important: children who followed rules first — who understood the original structure — built more coherent modifications than those who ignored the rulebook entirely from the start. Following rules was not the opposite of creativity. It was often its prerequisite.
